name: preened
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
preen
preen verb
(TIDY)
[ I or T ] If a bird preens or preens itself, it cleans and arranges its feathers using its beak.
[ I or T ] disapproving to spend time making yourself look attractive: Roald always spends ages preening (himself) before he goes out.

preen verb
(FEEL PROUD)
preen yourself
to feel very proud or satisfied with yourself because of an action or quality: The government is publicly preening itself on the latest trade figures. The company preened itself for having taken on so many new employees last year.
